alert.note: Alert for Childress (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:28PM CDT until June 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CHILDRESS COUNTY... At 627 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles north of Childress, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 614 PM CDT, a wind gust of 61 mph was measured by the mesonet near Childress. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Childress and Tell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
